content.thinking: The results are showing mostly node_modules files. Let me search more specifically in the src or app directory for task-related files.
Found some files in the app directory. Let me read them to see how tasks are structured.

I can see the task structure. The default tasks are defined in lines 37-43. They have:
- id: number
- text: string
- status: "backlog" | "todo" | "in-progress" | "done"
- dueDate?: string (format: "YYYY-MM-DD")
- priority?: "low" | "medium" | "high"

I'll add a few more fake tasks to this list to give the app more sample data. I should add tasks in different statuses and with varying priorities and due dates.

content.text: I can see the task structure. I'll add a few more fake tasks to the default list.

content.thinking: I've added 7 new fake tasks across different statuses (backlog, todo, in-progress, done) with varying priorities and due dates. The user should now see a more populated kanban board.

content.text:
Added 7 new fake tasks:

- **Backlog**: "Refactor auth module", "Set up CI/CD pipeline", "Optimize database queries"
- **To Do**: "Design new landing page", "Write API documentation"  
- **In Progress**: "Fix mobile responsiveness"
- **Done**: "Add dark mode toggle"

The tasks have a mix of priorities and due dates. Note: if you've already used the app, you'll need to clear localStorage (or use an incognito window) to see the new defaults, since existing data takes precedence.
